extends java.lang.Object

    Given a Player and a Position, this method is in charge to tell the bot whether it attacked succesfully or not and if he was, makes the player receive the shot with everything that conveys.

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static Game getInstance()
      This method returns the already existing instance of Game if it exists. If not, a new instance is created and returned following the Memento pattern.
      Returns:
      the unique Game instance.

    • botAttack

      boolean botAttack​(int player, Position pos)
      Given a Player and a Position, this method is in charge to tell the bot whether it attacked succesfully or not and if he was, makes the player receive the shot with everything that conveys.
      Parameters:
      player - the Player that is being attacked by a bot.
      pos - the Position that is being attacked.
      Returns:
      true if he was able to attack, false otherwise.
      See Also:
      BotPlayer.attack()

    • getPlayer

      Player getPlayer​(int p)
      Gets the instance of the Player represented by an int indicating its position in the list of players.
      Parameters:
      p - an int that indicates the index of the player in the list of players.
      Returns:
      said Player.

    • attackShip

      public boolean attackShip​(int player, Position pos) throws CommandExecuteException
      Attacks a player's Position and return wether a Ship was hit.
      Parameters:
      player - the Player to attack.
      pos - the Position to attack.
      Returns:
      true if a Ship was hit.
      Throws:
      CommandExecuteException - if either the position or the attacked player are not valid.

    • attackBot

      public void attackBot()
      Makes the currentPlayer, which is a bot, attack.

    • getLevel

      public Level getLevel()
      Gets the game's Level.
      Returns:
      the game's Level.

    • attackShip

      public void attackShip​(java.lang.String p, Position pos) throws CommandExecuteException
      Given a Position and a Player represented by its name, this method attacks said player.
      Parameters:
      p - the String that represents the player's name.
      pos - the Position to attack.
      Throws:
      CommandExecuteException - if the attack cannot be performed.

    • attackShip

      public void attackShip​(Player player, Position pos) throws CommandExecuteException
      Given a Position and a Player, this method attacks said player.
      Parameters:
      player - the Player to attack.
      pos - the Position to attack.
      Throws:
      CommandExecuteException - if the attack cannot be performed.

    • updateObservers

      public void updateObservers()
      Updates the observers giving them an instance of GameDTO. This method is only used for the GamePrinter.

    • endScreen

      private void endScreen​(Player player)
      Notifies the observers in observers that the game has finished.
      Parameters:
      player - the Player that has won the game.

    • hasLost

      public boolean hasLost​(int player)
      Checks if a Player has been defeated.
      Parameters:
      player - the Player to check.
      Returns:
      true if the player has lost, false otherwise.

    • getDimX

      public int getDimX()
      Gets the X dimension of the game's level.
      Returns:
      an int representing the X dimension of the game's Level.

    • allShipsPlaced

      public boolean allShipsPlaced​(int player)
      Given an int representing a player's index in the list of players, returns wether that player has placed all of its ships.
      Parameters:
      player - an int representing the Player to check.
      Returns:
      true if the player has placed all of its ships, false otherwise.

    • getDimY

      public int getDimY()
      Gets the Y dimension of the game's level.
      Returns:
      an int representing the Y dimension of the game's Level.

    • addObserver

      public void addObserver​(GameObserver observer)
      Adds a GameObserver to the list of observers.
      Parameters:
      observer - the GameObserver to be added.

    • place

      public boolean place​(int player)
      Makes a Player place his boats.
      Parameters:
      player - the Player that places the boats.
      Returns:
      false if the player is real, true otherwise.

    • attack

      public boolean attack​(int player)
      Makes a Player attack.
      Parameters:
      player - the Player that will attack.
      Returns:
      false if the player is real, true otherwise.

    • isFinished

      public boolean isFinished()
      Checks only one Player is still alive, meaning the game has finished. If so, it calls the method endScreen(Player) with the winner to notify the observers.
      Returns:
      true if the game has finished, false otherwise.

    • getState

      private org.json.JSONObject getState()
      Returns a JSONObject instance containing the following values:
      • level: a String indicating the game's level.
      • players: a JSONArray with the information returned by the method Player.getState() of each player in players.
      • currentPlayer: an int that indicates the index of the currentPlayer in the list of players.
      Returns:
      a JSONObject with said values.

    • placeShip

      public void placeShip​(int ship, Position pos, Orientation o) throws CommandExecuteException
      Makes the currentPlayer place his Ship represented by an int index and notifies the GameObservers in observers.
      Parameters:
      ship - an int that represents the ship to be placed.
      pos - the Position of the ship to be placed.
      o - the Orientation of the ship to be placed.
      Throws:
      CommandExecuteException - if the ship cannot be placed correctly.

    • placeShip

      public void placeShip​(Position pos, Orientation o) throws CommandExecuteException
      Makes the currentPlayer place his currentShip and notifies the GameObservers in observers.
      Parameters:
      pos - the Position of the ship to be placed.
      o - the Orientation of the ship to be placed.
      Throws:
      CommandExecuteException - if the ship cannot be placed correctly.

    • placeCurrentPlayerShips

      public void placeCurrentPlayerShips()
      Makes the currentPlayer place his Ships and notifies the GameObservers in observers. No ships are placed if the currentPlayer is a real player.

    • init

      public void init​(Level l, int numRealPlayers, int numBotPlayers, java.lang.String[] names) throws CommandExecuteException
      Initializes the game by setting its Level, the number of real players and their names and the number of bot players. It also sets the currentPlayer and the currentPlayerNum.
      Parameters:
      l - the Level that will be set.
      numRealPlayers - an int indicating the number of real players of the game.
      numBotPlayers - an int indicating the number of bot players of the game.
      names - a String array containing the names of the real players.
      Throws:
      CommandExecuteException - if two or more players share the same names.

    • addPlayer

      public void addPlayer​(Player p) throws CommandExecuteException
      Adds a Player to the list of players.
      Parameters:
      p - the Player to be added.
      Throws:
      CommandExecuteException - if a Player with the same name already exists.

    • getPlayerID

      public java.lang.String getPlayerID​(int i)
      This method returns the name of the Player at a certain index in the list of players.
      Parameters:
      i - an int indicating the index of the Player.
      Returns:
      a String indicating the name of the Player.

    • isCurrentPlayer

      public boolean isCurrentPlayer​(int i)
      Returns wether the Player at a certain index is the currentPlayer.
      Parameters:
      i - an int representing the index to check.
      Returns:
      true if the currentPlayer has that index, false otherwise.

    • getNumberOfPlayers

      public int getNumberOfPlayers()
      Returns the number of players.
      Returns:
      an int representing the number of players.

    • checkMiss

      public boolean checkMiss​(int player, Position pos)
      Given a certain int representing a Player and a Position, returns the result of calling Player.checkMiss(Position).

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      This method converts to a String the resulting JSONObject obtained from calling getState().
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      the mentioned String.

    • save

      public void save​(java.lang.String file)
      Given a file path represented by a String, this method saves the current Game to a file with .json extension.
      Parameters:
      file - a String representing the file path.

    • load

      public void load​(org.json.JSONObject jsonInput) throws GameParseException
      Given a JSONObject that represents a saved Game, this method tries to parse it and change all relevant attributes.
      Parameters:
      jsonInput - the JSONObject that contains the game's data.
      Throws:
      GameParseException - if the JSONObject has incorrect format or its data is not correct.

    • checkPlayer

      boolean checkPlayer​(int p)
      Checks if a Player represented by an int is different from the currentPlayer and is still alive.
      Parameters:
      p - an int indicating the player.
      Returns:
      true if the player is different from the currentPlayer and is still alive, false otherwise.

    • notifyPhaseChange

      public void notifyPhaseChange()
      Notifies the GameObservers in observers that the game phase has changed.

    • getCurrentPlayer

      public int getCurrentPlayer()
      Gets the index of the currentPlayer.
      Returns:
      an int representing the index of the currentPlayer in the list of players.

    • setCurrentPlayer

      public void setCurrentPlayer​(Player player)
      Given a Player, changes the game's currentPlayer.
      Parameters:
      player - the Player that will be set.

    • setCurrentPlayer

      public void setCurrentPlayer​(int player)
      Given a Player represented by an int, changes the game's currentPlayer.
      Parameters:
      player - an int representing the index of the Player that will be set.

    • getPlayers

      public java.util.List<PlayerDTO> getPlayers()
      Gets a List of PlayerDTO with the information of the game's players.
      Returns:
      a list of PlayerDTO.

    • checkPosition

      boolean checkPosition​(Position pos)
      Checks if a Position is within bounds for the current Game and its Level.
      Parameters:
      pos - the Position to check.
      Returns:
      true if the position is within bounds, false otherwise.

    • setCurrentShip

      public void setCurrentShip​(int i)
      Given the index of a Ship, this method sets that ship as currentShip for the currentPlayer.
      Parameters:
      i - an int representing the index of the ship.

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets the game's players.
